intro: Roldana hartwegii var. durangensis, commonly known as the Durango roldana, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the mountainous regions of Durango, Mexico. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and at high altitudes, showcasing adaptations to its harsh environment. Its leaves are finely divided and emit a distinctive scent when crushed, a trait common in the Apiaceae family. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
